- Pair of 6s (positions 2 and 8)

**Perfect! I have TWO PAIR!**

2. Shoot the Moon: +13 Mult per Queen held in hand

**Boss Constraint:** Play only 1 hand type this round. I've been playing Two Pair exclusively, so this works perfectly.

**Calculating the hand:**
I should play the two pairs: Jacks (positions 6, 7) and 6s (positions 2, 8), and hold the Queen of Clubs to trigger Shoot the Moon.

Let me calculate chips:
- Two Pair Level 3: Base 60 chips, Base 4 mult
- Cards that participate in the hand: Jack of Clubs (+10), Jack of Diamonds (+10), 6 of Spades (+6), 6 of Diamonds (+6)
- Total from played cards: 10 + 10 + 6 + 6 = 32 chips
- Blue Joker: +78 chips
- Total chips: 60 + 32 + 78 = 170 chips


- Multiplier from base hand: 4
- Shoot the Moon bonus from held Queen: +13 mult
- Final multiplier: 17
- Total score: 170 × 17 = 2,890 chips

This far exceeds the 1,600 needed. I'll play positions 2, 6, 7, 8 for the two pairs and keep the Queen since it provides both the $3 bonus and the crucial +13 mult multiplier.

The other cards—9 of Spades, Ace of Hearts, 4 of Hearts—don't offer any special triggers, so holding just the Queen maximizes my score. Playing the two Jacks and two 6s gives me the Two Pair hand type I need.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

Standard Pack just adds basic cards to the deck, which isn't a priority right now. Director's Cut costs exactly what I have and would let me reroll the boss blind once per ante—valuable insurance as I push toward Ante 8. Alternatively, I could spend $6 on another reroll and have $4 remaining to hunt for a Two Pair planet card or better joker options.

Lucky Cards offer a 1/5 chance for +20 mult, and Bonus Cards give +30 chips when scored. These enhancements could meaningfully amplify my Two Pair scoring, especially on frequently played cards like face cards.

Rerolling for $6 might land a Two Pair planet, but it's uncertain and leaves me with minimal funds afterward. Director's Cut would drain my entire budget without directly improving my current strong position. The Arcana Pack at $4 is the better play—it provides immediate card upgrades while preserving $6 for flexibility, and persistent enhancements compound throughout the run.
